analyzed: phyis ni 'grub par nges pa med pa'i phyir // phyis 'di yang dag 'byor par ga la 'gyur //
translated: Since it is not certain that it will be accomplished later,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: how will this [human existence of leisure and opportunity] be obtained again?

original: da ni spyod pa sgrub pa'i rten nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni spyod pa sgrub pa'i rten nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /

original: ji ltar mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Just as at night... and so forth.

original: 'jig rten te theg pa chen po'i rigs can dag gi rgyud la dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa dang phrad pa la brten nas bsod nams te dge ba'i chos bdag bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang sdug bsngal dang bral zhing /üîΩbde ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i byams pa dang snying @292a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten te theg pa chen po'i rigs can dag gi rgyud la dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa dang phrad pa la brten nas bsod nams te dge ba'i chos bdag bzhin du sems can thams cad la yang sdug bsngal dang bral zhing / bde ba bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa'i byams pa dang snying @292a * //
translated: In the mindstreams of those who are worldly, that is, who have the Mahayana potential, the thought of love and compassion, which is the wish that all beings be free from suffering and that they achieve happiness, arises occasionally on account of their having met with the perfect freedoms and advantages.

original: rje'i bdag nyid kyi blo gros thang 'ga' zhig 'byung gi gtan du 'byung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: rje'i bdag nyid kyi blo gros thang 'ga' zhig 'byung gi gtan du 'byung ba ma yin pas /

original: de thob pa chud mi za bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de thob pa chud mi za bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: So it is said that we must not waste the opportunity that we have now.

original: de ni rten khyad par can thob pa'i gang zag des nyams su blang ba'i rim pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ni rten khyad par can thob pa'i gang zag des nyams su blang ba'i rim pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The following verse is stated in terms of the stages of practice by the person who has attained this special support, that is, the bodhisattva ideal.

original: re zhig spyod pa bsgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin pas de'i phan yon bstan pa dang / de ltar dge ba nyam chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩ'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: re zhig spyod pa bsgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin pas de'i phan yon bstan pa dang / de ltar dge ba nyam chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'dir bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning of this is stated in the verse beginning with ‚ÄúThe virtue is weak,‚Äù and so on.

original: dge ba bsgrub pa'i rten ni dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa yin la 'di ni shin tu rnyed par dka' bas de la brten pa'i dge ba'i chos ni shin tu nyam chung ba'i phyir dang mi dge ba sgrub pa'i rten mi khom pa'i gnas ni shin tu rnyed
analyzed: dge ba bsgrub pa'i rten ni dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa yin la 'di ni shin tu rnyed par dka' bas de la brten pa'i dge ba'i chos ni shin tu nyam chung ba'i phyir dang mi dge ba sgrub pa'i rten mi khom pa'i gnas ni shin tu rnyed
translated: The support for the practice of virtue is the endowment with the freedoms and endowments, and this is very difficult to obtain. Therefore, the virtuous dharmas based on it are extremely weak, and the support for the practice of non-virtue, the states without freedom, are very easy to obtain.

original: par sla bas de bstan pa'i mi dge ba'i chos ni dpag tu med pa rgyud la gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: par sla bas de bstan pa'i mi dge ba'i chos ni dpag tu med pa rgyud la gnas pa yin la /

original: de rnams ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa rnam pa gnyis kyis spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams ni byang chub chen por sems bskyed pa rnam pa gnyis kyis spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those are eliminated by the two kinds of generation of the Thought of Enlightenment for the sake of great enlightenment.

original: de ni rten gyi stobs dang nyes pa las bzlog pa'i stobs khyad par can yin pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma nyan thos la sogs par smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dge ba gzhan dag gis ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rten gyi stobs dang nyes pa las bzlog pa'i stobs khyad par can yin pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma nyan thos la sogs par smon pa dang 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dge ba gzhan dag gis ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: Because it is the power of the support and the special power of turning away from faults, and because the remaining virtues of generating the aspiration and engagement mind of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are not like that,

original: de dag ni rten gyi stobs dang khyad par can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rten gyi stobs dang khyad par can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the power of the support and are not special.

original: de bas na dus dpag tu med par sems can gyi don la dgongs pa'i thub pa'i dbang po dngos kyis kyang nyan thos su sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i nang nas theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa nyid mchog tu phan par gzigs so zhes bya ba yin
analyzed: de bas na dus dpag tu med par sems can gyi don la dgongs pa'i thub pa'i dbang po dngos kyis kyang nyan thos su sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i nang nas theg pa chen por sems bskyed pa nyid mchog tu phan par gzigs so zhes bya ba yin
translated: Therefore, even the lords of sages, who consider the welfare of sentient beings for immeasurable time, see that generating the mind of the MahƒÅyƒÅna itself is most beneficial, from among generating the mind of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: no // phan yon gzhan yang byang chub sems bskyed pa 'dis ni gdul bya tshad med pa'i skye bo'i tshogs rnams kyis /
analyzed: no // phan yon gzhan yang byang chub sems bskyed pa 'dis ni gdul bya tshad med pa'i skye bo'i tshogs rnams kyis /
translated: Another benefit is that by generating the thought of awakening, one is able to benefit immeasurable numbers of sentient beings.

original: bde ba thams cad kyi mchog bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyang me lnga bsten pa la sogs pa lta bu'i lus gdung ba'i dka' thub drag po bya mi dgos par grub par byed pas bde blag nyid du thob par byed ces bshad do //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad kyi mchog bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyang me lnga bsten pa la sogs pa lta bu'i lus gdung ba'i dka' thub drag po bya mi dgos par grub par byed pas bde blag nyid du thob par byed ces bshad do //
translated: And it is said that one attains it with ease, because one attains the supreme bliss of unsurpassed buddhahood without having to undergo the severe austerities of tormenting the body, such as by relying on the five fires.

analyzed: 'di tsam gyis sdig pa spang zhing bde ba thob par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //

original: phan yon bstan pa'i sgo nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de gzung bar bya ba nyid du gdams ngag bstan pa /
analyzed: phan yon bstan pa'i sgo nas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de gzung bar bya ba nyid du gdams ngag bstan pa /
translated: The instruction on how to hold the generation of the thought of awakening that is taught through showing the benefits

original: 'jigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jigs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: is stated in the line ‚Äúfear and so forth.‚Äù

original: bdag gi rgyud la tshe 'di'i rgyal @292b po'i chad pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal brgya phrag dpag tu med pa gzhom par 'dod cing /
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud la tshe 'di'i rgyal @292b po'i chad pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal brgya phrag dpag tu med pa gzhom par 'dod cing /
translated: One who wishes to overcome the fear of the harm of the king and so forth in this life and the hundreds of immeasurable sufferings of cyclic existence in the next life

original: de bzhin du sems can gzhan gyi rgyud la tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i mi bde ba bsal bar 'dod pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba mang po brgya phrag dpag tu med pa spyod par 'dod pas kyang smon pa dang 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nyid rtag tu gtong bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gzhan gyi rgyud la tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i mi bde ba bsal bar 'dod pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la tshe 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba mang po brgya phrag dpag tu med pa spyod par 'dod pas kyang smon pa dang 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa nyid rtag tu gtong bar mi bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one who wishes to remove the unhappiness of this life and the next from the mindstreams of other sentient beings, and who wishes to experience the many hundreds of thousands of types of happiness of this life and the next in his own and others' mindstreams, should never give up the generation of the aspiration and application aspects of the thought of awakening.

original: gdon mi za bar sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sems bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: gzhan yang byang chub kyi sems bskyed par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub kyi sems bskyed par gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if one generates the thought of awakening,

original: de bskyed pa'i skad cig gis gang zag de 'khor ba'i brtson rar nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsdams pa skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i skad cig gis gang zag de 'khor ba'i brtson rar nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bsdams pa skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa rnams kyang /
translated: in that very instant, that person, who is bound in the prison of cyclic existence by various afflictions and is tormented by the suffering of birth and so forth,

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi sras // zhes brjod par bya zhing /
translated: is called a child of the sugatas.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /

analyzed: 'jig rten lha mir bcas pas phyag byar 'gyur // zhes smos te /
translated: He becomes worthy of worship by the world with its gods and men.

original: mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchod pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes an object of worship.

original: phan yon gzhan yang gser 'gyur rtsi'i zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phan yon gzhan yang gser 'gyur rtsi'i zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Another benefit is stated by ‚Äúlike the elixir of life, etc.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa sdang po bkod pa'i mdo las ji skad du rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdang po bkod pa'i mdo las ji skad du rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste /
translated: As it is said in the noble Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra, ‚ÄúNoble sir, it is like this:

analyzed: dper na dngul chu'i rigs gser du snang ba zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: There is a kind of mercury called ‚Äòappearing as gold.‚Äô

original: de ni srang gcig gis kyang lcags srang stong gser du bsgyur te /
analyzed: de ni srang gcig gis kyang lcags srang stong gser du bsgyur te /
translated: Even one measure of it can transform one thousand measures of iron into gold.

original: dngul chu srang gcig po de ni lcags srang stong po des zad par bya ba'am lcags su bsgyur bar mi nus so //
analyzed: dngul chu srang gcig po de ni lcags srang stong po des zad par bya ba'am lcags su bsgyur bar mi nus so //
translated: But that one measure of mercury cannot be exhausted by the one thousand measures of iron, nor can it be turned into iron.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i khu ba'i 'byung khungs dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bzung ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i lcags thams cad zad par byas te /

translated: In the same way, the source of the mercury of the spirit of unexcelled perfect enlightenment, when it is seized by the roots of virtue, can exhaust all the iron of the afflictions and actions that obscure the vision of omniscience,

original: chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu byed kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i khu ba'i 'byung khungs gcig po de ni las dang 'bras bu nyon mongs pa'i lcags thams cad kyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am zadüîΩpar bya bar mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu byed kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i khu ba'i 'byung khungs gcig po de ni las dang 'bras bu nyon mongs pa'i lcags thams cad kyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am zad par bya bar mi nus so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Although all phenomena are made the color of omniscience, the source of the sap of the generation of the enlightenment mind cannot be made defiled or exhausted by any of the iron afflictions of karma and its result.

original: de lta bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon ni dpag tu med pa dang ldan par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa gang zhig bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la spangs pa dang @293a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phan yon ni dpag tu med pa dang ldan par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa gang zhig bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la spangs pa dang @293a * //
translated: Thus, the benefits of generating the enlightenment mind are seen by the Tathagatas to be endowed with immeasurable qualities.

original: ye shes thob par 'dod pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bur dkon pa dang rin che dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa las skyob pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes thob par 'dod pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bur dkon pa dang rin che dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa las skyob pa ste /
translated: Whoever has the realization that the mind of enlightenment is like a precious wish-fulfilling gem, which is rare, valuable, delightful, helpful, and protective from harm by non-humans, etc.,üîΩand who desires to attain the wisdom of abandonment in one's own and others' continuums, should generate the mind of enlightenment.

original: dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir dang go rims bzhin du lus dang longs spyod dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba btang dgos pa'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis bde ba la reg par byed pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir dang go rims bzhin du lus dang longs spyod dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba btang dgos pa'i phyir dang / 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis bde ba la reg par byed pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to make one attain bliss through the stages of non-remorse, andüîΩin order to generate immeasurable collections of merit and wisdom, and

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa skyed pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyis na gzhan dag gi gnod pas mi tshugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dpag tu med pa skyed pa'i phyir dang / de nyid kyis na gzhan dag gi gnod pas mi tshugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because of that, in order that one not be harmed by the harm of others.

original: de bas na yongs su gzung bar bya dgos pas /
analyzed: de bas na yongs su gzung bar bya dgos pas /
translated: Therefore, one must take them up.

original: 'gro ba'i ded dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ded dpon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thus, he says, the captain of the ship of beings, and so on.

original: gzhan yang dge ba gzhan kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba gzhan kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Moreover, all other virtues, and so on, indicate

translated: Just as a plantain tree ends when it bears fruit, likewise, those virtues not embraced by the excellent support of generating the thought of awakening and the excellent dedication to great awakening produce their own results and then are exhausted.üîΩBut those roots of virtue embraced by the excellent support of generating the thought of awakening and the excellent dedication are not exhausted until one attains great awakening.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rten dam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dam pas yongs su zin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis ni ji srid du byang chub chen po ma thob kyi bar du mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu 'byin zhing de zad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rten dam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dam pas yongs su zin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyis ni ji srid du byang chub chen po ma thob kyi bar du mngon par mtho ba'i 'bras bu 'byin zhing de zad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They produce the result of high rebirth and do not become exhausted.

original: mthar byang chub chen po thob pas 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mthar byang chub chen po thob pas 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'am /
translated: They increase until one attains great awakening.

original: yang byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu 'byin zhing 'khor ba ji srid ma stongs par gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ram /üîΩyang na bdag gi don gyi 'bras bu 'byin cing /
analyzed: yang byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu 'byin zhing 'khor ba ji srid ma stongs par gzugs kyi sku rnam pa gnyis 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir ram / yang na bdag gi don gyi 'bras bu 'byin cing /
translated: Moreover, it produces the result of great enlightenment and increases without end because it performs the purpose of beings with the two kinds of form body for as long as cyclic existence is not emptied.

original: gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang sgrub par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, it produces the result for one's own benefit and accomplishes the benefit of others.

analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pas mi zad 'phel bar 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it produces the result and increases without end.

original: 'dis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad par bsrung zhing lus la sogs pa spel ba'i thabs nyid du yang ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'di nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad par bsrung zhing lus la sogs pa spel ba'i thabs nyid du yang ston to //
translated: This shows that this very generation of enlightenment mind is the method for protecting the roots of virtue without end and for increasing the body and so forth.

original: phan yon gzhan yang /
analyzed: phan yon gzhan yang /
translated: Another benefit is stated

original: sdig pa shin tu mi zad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: sdig pa shin tu mi zad ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: by evil is utterly inexhaustible and so on.

original: grogs khyad par can la brten nas dgra la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa chen po las skyob pa bzhin du smon pa'i @293b sems bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyes pa las bzlog pa'i stobs kyis kyang sdig pa las grol ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grogs khyad par can la brten nas dgra la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa chen po las skyob pa bzhin du smon pa'i @293b sems bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyes pa las bzlog pa'i stobs kyis kyang sdig pa las grol ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as one is protected from great dangers such as enemies by relying on a special friend, so also by the power of turning away from one's own faults through generating the aspiration mind, one is freed from evil.

original: sdig pa sbyang bar 'dod pa rnams kyis gdon mi za bar bsten par bya dgos te /
analyzed: sdig pa sbyang bar 'dod pa rnams kyis gdon mi za bar bsten par bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, those who wish to purify evil must certainly rely on it.

original: des na bskal ba'i mi bzhin du nyes byas rnams sreg pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa ste /
analyzed: des na bskal ba'i mi bzhin du nyes byas rnams sreg pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa ste /
translated: Thus, one should think that one's faults will be burned up like a kalpa fire.

original: 'di tsam gyi phan yon rig pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyi phan yon rig pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: This is taught by way of knowing the benefits of just this much.

original: da ni lung gi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lung gi sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach by way of scripture, it says,

original: de'i phan yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phan yon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The benefits of that and so forth.

original: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: In the Marvelous Array Sutra,

analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the mind of enlightenment is like the seed of all the Buddha's teachings.

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bas zhing lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bas zhing lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a field because the white dharmas of all beings increase.

original: 'jig rten thams cad rten pas sa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad rten pas sa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the earth, for it supports the whole world.

original: dbul ba thams cad yang dag par gcod pas rnam thos kyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbul ba thams cad yang dag par gcod pas rnam thos kyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: It is like Vaisravana, for it completely destroys poverty.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yongs su bsrung bas pha lta bu'o //üîΩdon thams cad yang dag par 'grub pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yongs su bsrung bas pha lta bu'o // don thams cad yang dag par 'grub pas yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a father, for it is protected by all bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, for it accomplishes all aims.

original: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a good vase, for it fulfills all wishes.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra pham par byed pas mdung thung lta bu'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra pham par byed pas mdung thung lta bu'o /
translated: It is like a spear, for it conquers the enemy, the afflictions.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'gegs pas go cha lta bu'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa'i mgo ltung bar byed pas ral gri lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'gegs pas go cha lta bu'o // nyon mongs pa'i mgo ltung bar byed pas ral gri lta bu'o //
translated: It is like armor, for it wards off unwholesome attention.üîΩIt is like a sword, for it cuts off the head of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i shing gcod par byed pas sta re lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i shing gcod par byed pas sta re lta bu'o //
translated: It is like an axe, for it cuts down the tree of the afflictions.

original: 'tshe ba thams cad las skyab pas mtshon cha lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba thams cad las skyab pas mtshon cha lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a weapon, for it protects from all violence.

original: 'khor ba'i chu'i nang na gnas pa steng du 'byin pas mchil pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chu'i nang na gnas pa steng du 'byin pas mchil pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a hook, since it draws out those who are in the water of cyclic existence.

original: sgrib pa thams cad khebs pa'i sa thams cad rnam par 'thor pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad khebs pa'i sa thams cad rnam par 'thor pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a wind-wheel, since it scatters the dust of all obscurations from all the levels.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir mdor bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir mdor bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a summary, since it includes all the bodhisattva practices and vows.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten la mchod rten lta bu ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten la mchod rten lta bu ste /
translated: It is like a shrine, for the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni yon tan de dag dang yon tan gyi bye brag tshad med pa gzhan dag dang ldan no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni yon tan de dag dang yon tan gyi bye brag tshad med pa gzhan dag dang ldan no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Son of noble family, the mind of awakening has these qualities and other immeasurable specific qualities.

original: 'o na yon tan de la bu dang ldan yang bdag cag lta bu so so'i skye bo la skyed rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yon tan de la bu dang ldan yang bdag cag lta bu so so'i skye bo la skyed rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Well then, even though it has those qualities, is it still possible for ordinary beings like us to give rise to it?

original: skyed rung ba nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyed rung ba nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that it is possible.

original: bslab pa kun las btus pa las ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bslab pa kun las btus pa las ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As the Compendium of Trainings says:

original: da ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba @294a * //
analyzed: da ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba @294a * //
translated: Now, in order to explain the divisions of the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: byang chub sems su mdor bsdu na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems su mdor bsdu na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In brief, the Thought of EnlightenmentüîΩis the will to the three enlightenments.

original: yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: yang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The divisions of the Thought of Enlightenment are

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: earth, gold, moon, fire,üîΩand so on, twenty-two in all.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis nyid du 'byung ba las 'di ni sems bskyed pa dang po 'dun pa dang ldan pa lta bu'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis nyid du 'byung ba las 'di ni sems bskyed pa dang po 'dun pa dang ldan pa lta bu'i dbang du byas pa yin la /
translated: Of these, the present one is from the viewpoint of the first Thought of Enlightenment, that of the will-endeavor.

original: yang sems bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: yang sems bskyed pa ni /
translated: Again, the Thought of EnlightenmentüîΩis fourfold:üîΩAspirational, engaged,

original: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
analyzed: mos dang lhag bsam dag pa dang // rnam par smin pa gzhan du 'dod //
translated: purely motivated, and maturational.

original: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, it is the abandonment of obscurations.

original: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bur rnam pa bzhi nyid du dbye ba las 'di ni mos pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dbang du byas pa yin zhing ;
analyzed: zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bur rnam pa bzhi nyid du dbye ba las 'di ni mos pa'i sems bskyed pa'i dbang du byas pa yin zhing ;
translated: As explained, it is divided into four kinds. Of these, the present one is from the viewpoint of the aspirational Thought of Enlightenment.

original: yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa rnam pa gnyis las 'di ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i dbang du byas pa las de nyid la yang dag par blangs pa brda las byung ba dang chos nyid kyis thob pa dang rnam pa gnyis
analyzed: yang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa rnam pa gnyis las 'di ni kun rdzob byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i dbang du byas pa las de nyid la yang dag par blangs pa brda las byung ba dang chos nyid kyis thob pa dang rnam pa gnyis
translated: And of that, there are two types: that which is taken up correctly, and that which is obtained by the power of the nature of things.

original: las / 'di ni yang dag par blangs ba brda las byung ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: las / 'di ni yang dag par blangs ba brda las byung ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: This is from the point of view of that which is taken up correctly.

original: de ltar yang sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /üîΩrigs kyi bu sems can dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems smon pa de dag kyang dkon na /
analyzed: de ltar yang sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las gsungs pa / rigs kyi bu sems can dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems smon pa de dag kyang dkon na /
translated: Thus, the Gandavyuha sutra says:üîΩSon of noble family, if those sentient beings who aspire to the thought of unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment are rare,

original: de bas kyang gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chas pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu dkon no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas kyang gang dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu chas pa'i sems can de dag ni shin tu dkon no zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: then those sentient beings who set out for unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment are even rarer.

original: de la smon pa'i sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo ni sems can thams cad kyi don du bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur cig snyam du byang chub dang sems can gnyis la dmigs pa'i don
analyzed: de la smon pa'i sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo ni sems can thams cad kyi don du bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur cig snyam du byang chub dang sems can gnyis la dmigs pa'i don
translated: The essence of the generation of the aspiration thought is the thought, I shall become a perfect complete Buddha for the sake of all sentient beings, which is the aspiration for the aim of both enlightenment and sentient beings,

original: du gnyer ba'i 'dun pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dper na 'gro bar 'dod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: du gnyer ba'i 'dun pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dper na 'gro bar 'dod pa lta bu ste /
translated: and the mental consciousness concomitant with it, like the desire to go.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: This is as it occurs in Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: de la 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni spong ba'i sems pa dang 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni spong ba'i sems pa dang 'jug pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The essence of the generation of the entrance thought is the mental consciousness concomitant with the thought of abandonment and the thought of entrance, together with its propensities.

original: de sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni spong ba'i sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: de sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni spong ba'i sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: The morality of restraint has the essence of the thought of abandonment.

original: lhag ma gnyis ni 'jug pa'i sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma gnyis ni 'jug pa'i sems pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The remaining two have the essence of the thought of entrance.

original: de ni dper na lam du zhugs te chas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni dper na lam du zhugs te chas pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like setting out on a journey.

original: 'on te smon pa'i sems @294b bskyed pas chog mod /
analyzed: 'on te smon pa'i sems @294b bskyed pas chog mod /
translated: But if it is sufficient to generate the aspiration thought,

original: 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pas ci zhig bya zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pas ci zhig bya zhe na ma yin te /
translated: what is the use of generating the application thought?

original: 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa ni smon pa las kyang 'bras bu bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa ni smon pa las kyang 'bras bu bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu che ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is not so, because the generation of the application thought is superior to the generation of the aspiration thought in terms of the mass of merit that is its effect.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: byang chub smon pa'i sems las ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byang chub smon pa'i sems las ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The generation of the thought of aspirationüîΩis not equal to the generation of the thought of application.

original: smon pa'i sems bskyed pa las 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: smon pa'i sems bskyed pa las 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow do you know that a great result arises from the generation of the aspiration thought while transmigrating in cyclic existence?‚Äù

original: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pa'i rnam par thar pa las gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: It is as stated in the noble Liberation of Maitreya:

original: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: ‚ÄúSon of noble family, it is like this.

original: rdo rje rin po che ni chag kyang gser gyi rgyan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rin po che'i ming yang mi 'dor zhing dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go //
analyzed: rdo rje rin po che ni chag kyang gser gyi rgyan khyad par du 'phags pa thams cad zil gyis gnon cing rin po che'i ming yang mi 'dor zhing dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go //
translated: Even if a vajra gem is broken, it outshines all golden ornaments and does not lose the name gem, it also removes all poverty.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che ni nan tan dang bral yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon cing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen par sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che ni nan tan dang bral yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon cing /
translated: Son of good family, likewise, even if the vajra gem of generating the mind of omniscience is divorced from practice, it outshines all the golden ornaments of the qualities of ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,üîΩand it also removes all the poverty of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dbul ba thams cad kyang rnam par bzlog go zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rgyal po la gdams pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And likewise, the Instruction to the King S≈´tra says:

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ltar khyod ni bya ba mang ba byed pa mang ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ltar khyod ni bya ba mang ba byed pa mang ba ste /
translated: Great King, it is like this: you have many things to do, you have many activities.üîΩIn every way, in all aspects, you should train in the perfection of generosity,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa nas /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab pa nas /
translated: and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bslab par mi nus kyis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la bslab par mi nus kyis /
translated: You will not be able to train in the perfections, from generosity to wisdom.

original: de bas na rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa dang don du gnyer ba dang / smon pa 'gro yang rung 'grong yang rung 'dug kyang rung sad kyang rung rtag par rgyun du dran par gyis la yid la zung ste sgoms shig dang /
analyzed: de bas na rgyal po chen po khyod yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dun pa dang don du gnyer ba dang / smon pa 'gro yang rung 'grong yang rung 'dug kyang rung sad kyang rung rtag par rgyun du dran par gyis la yid la zung ste sgoms shig dang /
translated: Therefore, Great King, whether you are walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, always and continuously remember, keep in mind, and cultivate the aspiration, pursuit, and yearning for perfect complete enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / bdag nyid kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus shing gzhol te rtsis la rjes su yi rang ba mchog dang nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / so so'i skye bo thams cad dang / bdag nyid kyi 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsdus shing gzhol te rtsis la rjes su yi rang ba mchog dang nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang /
translated: Gather, focus, calculate, and rejoice in all the roots of virtue of all buddhas, bodhisattvas, noble ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and ordinary beings, as well as all your own past, future, and present roots of virtue, with the highest, space-like rejoicing.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rang nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod par bya ba bul cig / phul nas sems can thams cad dang thun mong @295a * //üîΩdu gyis shig / de nas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du 'thob bar 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos shig / rgyal po chen po khyod de ltar zhugs na rgyal po'i bya ba yang nyams
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig / rjes su yi rang nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod par bya ba bul cig / phul nas sems can thams cad dang thun mong @295a * // du gyis shig / de nas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du 'thob bar 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir nyin gcig bzhin du dus gsum du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos shig / rgyal po chen po khyod de ltar zhugs na rgyal po'i bya ba yang nyams
translated: Having offered, share it with all sentient beings.üîΩThen, three times a day, dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment so that all sentient beings will attain omniscience and perfect all the qualities of a Solitary Sage.

original: par mi 'gyur zhing byang chub kyi tshogs kyang rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur zhing byang chub kyi tshogs kyang rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Great King, if you practice in this way, you will not neglect your royal duties and you will complete the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: mdo sde de nyid las rnam par smin pa yang gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo sde de nyid las rnam par smin pa yang gsungs te /
translated: That same sutra also speaks of the fruitions:

original: rgyal po chen po khyed yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam par smin pas lan du mar lha'i nang du skye /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyed yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam par smin pas lan du mar lha'i nang du skye /
translated: Great King, by the fruitions of the roots of virtue of the mind of perfect enlightenment, you have been reborn among the gods many times,

original: lan du mar mi'i nang du skye ste lha dang mi'i skye bar 'gyur ba na dbang po byed par 'gyur kyang /
analyzed: lan du mar mi'i nang du skye ste lha dang mi'i skye bar 'gyur ba na dbang po byed par 'gyur kyang /
translated: and you have been reborn among humans many times, and in your rebirths as a god and a human, you have been a powerful lord.

original: da dung rgyal po chen po khyod kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las la bri ba'am gang bar mi mngon no //
analyzed: da dung rgyal po chen po khyod kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i las la bri ba'am gang bar mi mngon no //
translated: Great King, still, the roots of virtue of your mind of perfect enlightenment have not diminished or been exhausted.

original: 'on kyang rgyal po chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems gcig kyang sems can thams cad dga' bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyal po chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems gcig kyang sems can thams cad dga' bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad dbugs dbyung bar dmigs pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But, great king, the thought of highest genuine full Awakening is the thought of delighting all sentient beings, the thought of comforting all sentient beings, the thought of liberating all sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med dpag tu med pa la sogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba grangs med dpag tu med pa la sogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the roots of virtue from that are countless and immeasurable,

original: gang de ltar mang du byed pa lta ci smos zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang de ltar mang du byed pa lta ci smos zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: what need is there to speak of doing it more than that?üîΩThe merit does not arise continuously

original: ji ltar 'jug pa'i sems bzhin du //üîΩbsod nams rgyun chags 'byung ba min //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug pa'i sems bzhin du // bsod nams rgyun chags 'byung ba min //
translated: in the same way as the thought of entering.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhin du bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhin du bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The mass of merit does not arise in the same way as the thought of entering into the way of generating the thought of Awakening.

original: 'o na 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa las dus gang nas ji srid kyi bar du grangs du zhig rgya ji snyed 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jug pa'i sems bskyed pa las dus gang nas ji srid kyi bar du grangs du zhig rgya ji snyed 'byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, from what time, for how long, and how many times does the thought of entering arise?

original: go rims bzhin du lan btab pa'i phyir gang nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdeng nas bzung ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dus gang nas 'byung ba bstan to //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du lan btab pa'i phyir gang nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / deng nas bzung ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dus gang nas 'byung ba bstan to //
translated: The reply is given in order, so it is said, From now on... and so forth.üîΩFrom now on... indicates the time when it occurs.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dus ji srid 'byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par zhes bya ba'i bar gyis dus ji srid 'byung bar bstan to //

analyzed: 'on te gnas pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir shi 'phos kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa mi 'jog na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir nyan thos kyi sdom pa zhig kyang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa mi 'jig par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time it would follow that even the destruction of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow would not destroy the bodhisattva vow,

original: gnas pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir /

original: dper na tshe phyi ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshe phyi ma bzhin no //

analyzed: 'on te tshe phyi ma la ni gnas pa'i rten ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /

analyzed: 'o na ni tshe 'di la yang gnas pa'i rten ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs so //

analyzed: 'on te tshe 'dir rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spong ba'i phyir gnas pa'i phyir rten yin no zhe na /

analyzed: de ni tshe phyi ma la yang mtshungs te /

analyzed: de'i tshe rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spong ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'on te nyan thos kyi sdom pa med par byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa mi skye ba'i phyir rten du dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nyan thos kyi sdom pa med par byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa mi skye ba'i phyir rten du dgos so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is necessary as a basis because the bodhisattva vow does not arise without the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow,

analyzed: mi skye ba nyid sgrub pa'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not logical to establish that it does not arise.

original: 'on te nyan thos kyi sdom pa med par rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba mi spong ba'i phyir nyan thos kyi sdom pa rten du dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nyan thos kyi sdom pa med par rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba mi spong ba'i phyir nyan thos kyi sdom pa rten du dgos so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow is necessary as a basis because without the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow one does not abandon natural evil,üîΩthen it is the same in the next life,üîΩbecause one does not abandon natural evil at that time.

original: de ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi kha na ma tho ba rnam pa gnyis mi spong ngam ci nyan thos kyi sdom pa zhig rten du tshol bar byed /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi kha na ma tho ba rnam pa gnyis mi spong ngam ci nyan thos kyi sdom pa zhig rten du tshol bar byed /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni spong ba bcus bsdus pa ma yin nam /
translated: and the bodhisattva vow is not included in the ten vows.

analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos kyi sdom pa ni bdag nyid 'ba' zhig spong ba yin zhing /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa ni gzhan dag kyang spong du 'jug par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi snying po la thug gi bar du spong ba'i bdag nyid yin bzhin du de bor nas nyan thos kyi sdom pa rten du tshol bar byed pa ni bdag nyid blun por ston cing mkhas pa rnams kyis bzhad gad du bya bar rigs so //

translated: The bodhisattva vow is to engage others in abandoning nonvirtue and to abandon nonvirtue oneself until one reaches the essence of enlightenment.

original: de bas na sdom pa'i rten ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sdom pa'i rten ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa tshul khrims yin te /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: The Bodhisattva Levels says, ‚ÄúWhat is the ethics of gathering virtuous Dharmas?üîΩIt is the ethics of restraint and the ethics of collecting virtue.‚Äù

analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa la brten nas zhes 'byung ba dang / rnam par gtan la dbab pa bsdus pa las kyang /

original: mi dge ba'i las bcu spang ba'i phyir sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyid rten du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las bcu spang ba'i phyir sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyid rten du gsungs kyi /
translated: The Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna says that the ethics of restraint is taught to be the basis for abandoning the ten nonvirtuous actions.

original: nyan thos kyi sdom pa ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sdom pa ni de ltar ma yin te /

original: de las gzhan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba chos thams cad sdud par byed pa dang 'byor bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thams cad dus thams cad du bdag kyang spong zhing gzhan dag kyang spong du 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because they are not the basis for gathering and mastering all virtuous roots other than that and because they do not abandon all ten nonvirtuous actions at all times and do not cause others to abandon them.

original: ji ltar na sdom pa'i tshul khrims de dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdom pa'i tshul khrims de dge ba'i chos thams cad sdud par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is that ethics of restraint the basis for gathering all virtuous Dharmas?

analyzed: de la rang gi rgyud la dge ba'i chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa ste /

original: sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa byin pa dang / gzhan dag gnod par byed pa la mi bzlogs pa dang / de nyid la gong nas gong du mngon par spong ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i sar sems mi skyed kyi byang chub chen po nyid yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba dang /

translated: They give protection to all sentient beings, they do not retaliate when others harm them, they are ever more intent on that, they do not arouse the thought of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha levels, and they are never separate from keeping in mind the great enlightenment itself.

original: de yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir go rims bzhin sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Moreover, they are the essence of generosity, patience, effort, concentration, and wisdom, respectively, because they are fully embraced by the wisdom that is the complete purity of the three spheres and is free of apprehending subject and object.

original: tshul khrims gang bsrung ba de yang dngos sam brgyud pas sems can thams cad kyi don du 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims gang bsrung ba de yang dngos sam brgyud pas sems can thams cad kyi don du 'gyur ba'i phyir sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are the essence of the morality that accomplishes the welfare of sentient beings because the morality they guard directly or indirectly benefits all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar na de las dge ba'i chos thams cad 'byor bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de las dge ba'i chos thams cad 'byor bar byed pa yin zhe na /

original: gong ma lta bu'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pas 'gyod pa med pa'i sgo nas sems bde ba la reg par gnas pa'i phyir /üîΩdge ba'i chos sdud pa dang sems can gyi don @303a * //
analyzed: gong ma lta bu'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pas 'gyod pa med pa'i sgo nas sems bde ba la reg par gnas pa'i phyir / dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang sems can gyi don @303a * //
translated: Because one who abides in the morality of restraint as described above, free from regret, abides in the bliss of mind.

analyzed: byed pa'i tshul khrims la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bas na sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyid rten yin gyi /

translated: Those who have understanding should hold that the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow is not the basis.

analyzed: 'on te de ltar sdom pa'i tshul khrims rten du bshad pa nyid nyan thos kyi sdom pa nyid du 'grub pa yin te /
translated: But if the morality of restraint is explained as the basis in that way, it is established as the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow itself.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las sdom pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las sdom pa'i tshul khrims gang zhe na /
translated: The Bodhisattvabh≈´mi says, ‚ÄúWhat is the morality of restraint?

analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni sa bdun gyis bsdus pa ste zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The vows of individual liberation are included in the seven levels.

analyzed: de nyid nyan thos kyi sdom pa rten nyid du gyur pa'i khungs su mi rung ste /
translated: That is not a source for the assertion that the vows of individual liberation are the basis of the bodhisattva vows,üîΩbecause the Questions of UpƒÅli states that there are three types of vows of individual liberation:

analyzed: 'phags pa nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las nyan thos kyi so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi so sor thar pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang zhes gsum du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: But the sutra states the bodhisattva's pratimoksa vows from the perspective of the ethics of gathering virtue and of acting for the welfare of sentient beings.

analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas pa ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /

original: de la rigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / de ltar khyad par phye ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / de ltar khyad par phye ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: That is not so, because there is no logic for that and because the sutra itself states that the distinction is from the perspective of the ethics of restraint.

original: mdo nyid las bcos su rung ba'i khyad par ston pa'i skabs su mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa bcos su rung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo nyid las bcos su rung ba'i khyad par ston pa'i skabs su mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa bcos su rung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'o na slob dpon sa mu dra me ghas tshul khrims kyi le'u'i 'grel ba las nyan thos kyi sdom pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin no zhes bshad pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon sa mu dra me ghas tshul khrims kyi le'u'i 'grel ba las nyan thos kyi sdom pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gzhi yin no zhes bshad pa 'di ji ltar drang zhe na /
translated: are the basis of all virtuous dharmas?üîΩ This is because, just as the ≈õrƒÅvaka vows abandon natural and proscribed

analyzed: de ni nyan thos kyi sdom pas ji ltar rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba spong bzhin du sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis kyang spong bas /
translated: misdeeds, the ethics of the bodhisattva vows also abandon them.üîΩTherefore, the ethics of the bodhisattva vows are similar to the ≈õrƒÅvaka vows

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims nyid la spong bya thun mong ba spong bar 'dra ba'i phyir nyan thos kyi sdom pa zhes bstan te /
translated: in that they abandon the common misdeeds.üîΩFor example, the meditative stabilization possessed by the TathƒÅgata is

analyzed: dper @303b na de bzhin gshegs pa la mnga' ba'i bsam gtan la sogs pa la 'jig rten pa'i yon tan zhes bshad pa bzhin du yin gyi /

analyzed: dngos su nyan thos kyi sdom pa rten nyid du bshad pa ma yin te /
translated: But this does not directly explain that the ≈õrƒÅvaka vows are the basis.

original: sa lta ma yin na snga phyi yang 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa lta ma yin na snga phyi yang 'gal ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a seed, then it would contradict that it is past and future.

original: 'on te da ltar de ltar nyan thos kyi sdom pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims gnyis la mi 'dra ba'i khyad par ci lta bu zhig yod de snga ma rten ma yin la phyi ma ni rten nyid du gzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar de ltar nyan thos kyi sdom pa dang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims gnyis la mi 'dra ba'i khyad par ci lta bu zhig yod de snga ma rten ma yin la phyi ma ni rten nyid du gzhag ce na /
translated: If one asks, what is the difference between the two, the ethics of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow and the ethics of the bodhisattva vow? The former is not a basis and the latter is posited as a basis?

analyzed: kho bos ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa dang nyan thos kyi sdom pa'i khyad par ni dpag tu med pa yod kyang /
translated: We say that although there are immeasurable differences between the bodhisattva vow and the ≈õrƒÅvaka vow,

analyzed: gtsor na rten yang dag par len pa'i bsam pa'i sgo nas mi 'dra ba nyid du shes te /

analyzed: 'bras bcas te zhes bya ba ni de btang ba las 'byung ba'i 'bras bu dge ba'i rtsa ba yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na gsum po de mtha' dag gtong ba yin pas / bdog pa thams cad 'bras bcas te //

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, Everything one has, along with its result.

original: da ni tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te /üîΩnya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te / nya la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in terms of morality,üîΩit is said, fish, etc.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni nya la sogs pa mi 'chi bar bya ba'i don du srog gcod par byed pa'i nya ba la sogs pa de dag srog gcod pa la ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni nya la sogs pa mi 'chi bar bya ba'i don du srog gcod par byed pa'i nya ba la sogs pa de dag srog gcod pa la ni mi bya ste /

original: de ni tshigs che ba'i phyir dang / sngon gyi skyob pa rnams kyis da rung srog gcod pa spong ba'i tshul khrims yongs su ma rdzogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de bas na srog gcod pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de ni tshigs che ba'i phyir dang / sngon gyi skyob pa rnams kyis da rung srog gcod pa spong ba'i tshul khrims yongs su ma rdzogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de bas na srog gcod pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Because it is a great virtue,üîΩbecause it would follow that the former protectors did not completely accomplish the moral discipline abandoning taking life,üîΩand because the perfection of abandoning taking life is accomplished by merely obtaining the mind abandoning taking life in oneself, without the exertion of fishermen and so on.

original: bdag nyid la srog gcod pa spong ba'i sems thob pa tsam gyis nya ba la sogs pa sgrod pa'i tshegs med par mang srog gcod pa spong ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par lag tu 'ong ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid la srog gcod pa spong ba'i sems thob pa tsam gyis nya ba la sogs pa sgrod pa'i tshegs med par mang srog gcod pa spong ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims las byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par lag tu 'ong ba zhes bshad do //
translated: And it is explained that the root of virtue arising from moral discipline is brought into the hand.

original: tshul khrims la ji lta ba bzhin du bzod pa nas shes rab kyi bar du yang bdag nyid kyis sems bsrung ba las phyi rol du gnod pa byed pa'i dgra bo dang / le lo can gyi gang zag rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i gang zag spong ba la sogs pa'i tshegs med par bdag nyid kyi sems gnod sems dang le lo dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims la ji lta ba bzhin du bzod pa nas shes rab kyi bar du yang bdag nyid kyis sems bsrung ba las phyi rol du gnod pa byed pa'i dgra bo dang / le lo can gyi gang zag rnam par g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba'i gang zag spong ba la sogs pa'i tshegs med par bdag nyid kyi sems gnod sems dang le lo dang /
translated: Just as with discipline, so too with patience, effort, and meditation, one should protect one‚Äôs mind from external enemies who harm one, from internal laziness, from the distraction of being a person with faulty wisdom, and so on.üîΩBy simply protecting one‚Äôs mind from malice, laziness,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab las bsrungs pa tsam gyis /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab las bsrungs pa tsam gyis /

original: bzod pa nas shes rab kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzod pa nas shes rab kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /

original: dge ba thams cad lag tu 'ong ba'i zhes bshad do //
analyzed: dge ba thams cad lag tu 'ong ba'i zhes bshad do //

original: da ni bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas /

analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gnod sems byed pa spong ba zhes bya ba yang /

original: gnod sems pa'i dgra bo la sogs pa spong ba la mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnod sems pa'i dgra bo la sogs pa spong ba la mi bya ste /

original: dper na @310b rkang pa la tsher mas mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na @310b rkang pa la tsher mas mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, in order to prevent injury to the foot by a thorn,

original: sa stengs ko bas g-yogs pa ni mi 'grub kyi /
analyzed: sa stengs ko bas g-yogs pa ni mi 'grub kyi /

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: lham mthil tsam gyi ko bas rkang pa tshur g-yogs na /

analyzed: de ni tshegs chung ba'i phyir dang rkang pa la yang tsher mas mi 'dzug pa'i dgos pa yang 'grub pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de ni bsgrub par bya ba'i gnas yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

original: sems can mi srun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems can mi srun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach that, he says, the unruly sentient beings and so on.

original: da ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in terms of effort,

analyzed: gang gi tshe sems 'di nyid le lo las bsrungs na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa thob pa ltar gang gi tshe sems de 'di nyid le lo las ma bsrungs na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe las kyi lus ngag gnyi ga dang bcas kyang 'bras bu khyad par can thob pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: at that time, even though one has both the body and speech of karma, one does not obtain a special result.üîΩIn order to demonstrate this,

original: sems gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sems gsal zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúclear mind‚Äù and so on.

original: da ni bsam gtan gyi dbang du byas pa gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyi sems nyid bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par g-yeng ba las ma bsrungs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan gyi dbang du byas pa gang gi tshe bdag nyid kyi sems nyid bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par g-yeng ba las ma bsrungs pa'i tshe /
translated: Now, when one does not guard one‚Äôs own mind from distraction, which is the antithesis of concentration,

analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig dus ji srid du spyad kyang /
translated: then, no matter how much one practices roots of virtue for how long,

analyzed: rten dam pa dang / ched du bya ba dam pa dang / rnam par dag pa dam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dam pas yongs su ma zin na /
translated: If it is not embraced by the holy basis, the holy aim, the holy purity, and the holy dedication,

original: tshogs rgya chen po mi sog cing /
analyzed: tshogs rgya chen po mi sog cing /
translated: one does not accumulate the great collection of merit and

original: byang chub chen po thob par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: byang chub chen po thob par mi 'gyur bas /

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi sems 'di nyid rnam par g-yeng ba las bsrung bar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi sems 'di nyid rnam par g-yeng ba las bsrung bar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that one should protect one‚Äôs mind from distraction,

original: bzlas brjod dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bzlas brjod dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says ‚Äúrecitation‚Äù and so on.

original: da ni shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas bdag nyid kyi sems shes rab 'chal ba ste /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas bdag nyid kyi sems shes rab 'chal ba ste /
translated: Now, in terms of wisdom, one should protect one‚Äôs mind from the fault of bad wisdom,

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i las srung zhing /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa'i las srung zhing /
translated: from the fault of clinging to things,

analyzed: chos kyi don gyi mchog bdag med pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid kyi sems la nang du bcangs te bslab par bya ba 'dir ma gtogs na /
translated: and from the fault of not keeping in mind the mind that is the reality of selflessness, the supreme meaning of the Dharma.

original: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba ci byas pa thams cad kyang thabs la mkhas pa dam pas ma zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba ci byas pa thams cad kyang thabs la mkhas pa dam pas ma zin pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, whatever roots of virtue one has created, because they are not embraced by the highest skill in means,

analyzed: byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gang gis chos @311a * //
translated: they will not become the very cause for attaining great enlightenment.üîΩIn order to teach this,

analyzed: kyi don po mchog / ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhoever has the supreme goal of the Dharma,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: de ni mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to summarize that, he says, ‚ÄúThus,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsrungs pa'i phan yon dang ma bsrungs pa'i nyes dmigs yod pa de lta bas na /
analyzed: bsrungs pa'i phan yon dang ma bsrungs pa'i nyes dmigs yod pa de lta bas na /

analyzed: bdag gi sems 'di nyid bag yod pa la legs par gzung zhing /
translated: one should properly hold one‚Äôs mind to heedfulness

original: bag med pa las legs par bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bag med pa las legs par bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: and properly guard it from heedlessness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems bsrung zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sems bsrung zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúMind protection,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir sems bsrung ba nyid brtul zhugs kyi mchog yin pa ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa spong ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir sems bsrung ba nyid brtul zhugs kyi mchog yin pa ma gtogs pa /
translated: Because it is the antidote for eliminating obscurations, mind protection alone is the supreme spiritual practice.

original: sems brtul zhugs la mi gnas pa /
analyzed: sems brtul zhugs la mi gnas pa /

analyzed: gzhan lus ngag yid brtul zhugs mang pos ci zhig bya ste /

analyzed: 'on te de'i sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis la sogs pa yang don med par 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if it is asked whether the twelve ascetic virtues and so on are meaningless, they are not.

original: yang nyon mongs par bcas pa'i phyir yin pas /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs par bcas pa'i phyir yin pas /

analyzed: phyi rol brtul zhugs dag lta smos kyang ci dgos /

analyzed: ma grangs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: 'on te nyes dmigs dang phan yon ji lta bu zhig yod nas sems bsrung snyam na /

analyzed: rma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa dang / spyod pa 'di 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros so //
translated: The line the wound and so on is spoken, and the line such conduct and so on is spoken.

analyzed: 'on te ji tsam du sems bsrung bar bya snyam pa la / bdag gi rnyed dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa rnams dang yang bsngos nas sems bsrung bar bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: 'on te ji ltar sems bsrung bar bya snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar sems bsrung bar bya snyam na /

translated: The line one who wishes to protect the mind and so on is spoken. Abiding in vigilance is being aware of what should and should not be done.

original: dran pa la gnas pas ni de nyid la ma brjed pa'i phyir bya ba la 'jug cing bya ba ma yin pa'i cha spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa la gnas pas ni de nyid la ma brjed pa'i phyir bya ba la 'jug cing bya ba ma yin pa'i cha spong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mdor bstan pa de nyid rgyas par bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas nyes dmigs ji lta bu zhig yod na /

analyzed: de spong ba'i phyir dran pa dang shes bzhin la gnas par bya snyam pa'i dogs pa bsus na /

analyzed: dngos po @311b shes bzhin la mi gnas pa'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: The disadvantages of not being mindful and attentive are shown in three ways.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas /

original: nad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: nad kyis dkrugs pa bzhin du bya ba dang / ma yin pa shes pa'i phyir de dag la go rims bzhin du bsgrub pa dang spong ba'i mthu med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because one does not know what is to be done and what is not to be done, one lacks the power to accomplish and abandon them, respectively.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas /üîΩshes bzhin med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas / shes bzhin med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In the second place, it is said:üîΩWithout mindfulness and introspection,

analyzed: mang du thos pa la sogs pa ji snyed byas su zin kyang 'dir ni brjod du mi rung snyam pa'i shes bzhin med pa'i phyir brjed ngas par 'gyur bas thos pa nyid kyang chud za bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: even though one has done much listening, etc., one is forgetful because one lacks the introspection that thinks, ‚ÄúHere it is not proper to speak.‚Äù Thus, one‚Äôs listening is wasted.

original: gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The third is indicated by

original: thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the passage beginning ‚ÄúHe who is endowed with learning.‚Äù

original: mang du thos pa la sogs pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: mang du thos pa la sogs pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though he has much learning and so forth,

original: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'i phyir bya ba'i cha la 'jug pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa'i cha la 'jug pas ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'i phyir bya ba'i cha la 'jug pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa'i cha la 'jug pas ltung ba dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he is still subject to downfalls because he does not know what is to be done and what is not to be done, and so he engages in what is to be done and what is not to be done.

original: da ni dran pa la mi gnas pa'i nyes dmigs gnyis las /
analyzed: da ni dran pa la mi gnas pa'i nyes dmigs gnyis las /
translated: Now, the disadvantages of not being mindful are twofold.

original: dang po shes bzhin ma yin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyud la 'byung bar bstan pa /
analyzed: dang po shes bzhin ma yin pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgyud la 'byung bar bstan pa /
translated: First, the disadvantage of the arising of the secondary mental affliction of lack of vigilance is taught.

original: shes bzhin med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúHe who is without vigilance‚Äù indicates

original: bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes bzhin ma yin pa 'byung la /

original: le'u gnyis par ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: le'u gnyis par ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //

original: da ni gang la bslab par bya ba'i yul bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir rang ngam gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni gang la bslab par bya ba'i yul bsdus te bstan par bya ba'i phyir rang ngam gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: rang gi dbang du byas pa ste ;
analyzed: rang gi dbang du byas pa ste ;
translated: This is from the perspective of oneself.

original: sdom dang dge ba'i chos sdud kyis bsdus pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: sdom dang dge ba'i chos sdud kyis bsdus pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa ste /

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsdus pa'am /
translated: it is included in the performance of the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang spyod lam gyi gnas skabs gang du lus ngag yid gsum gyis ci spyod kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyod lam gyi gnas skabs gang du lus ngag yid gsum gyis ci spyod kyang /
translated: Moreover, whatever one does with one's body, speech, or mind in any situation of daily activity,üîΩone should train in whatever has been taught and in whatever way it has been taught.

original: gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab par gsungs pa ste ji skad du mdo dag las /
analyzed: gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar bslab par gsungs pa ste ji skad du mdo dag las /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas chos rab tu mang po la bslab par mi bgyi ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should not train in too many dharmas.üîΩHe should train in great compassion.üîΩAnd:üîΩThe bodhisattva should practice in such a way that as soon as they see him, sentient beings will be delighted.üîΩAnd:

original: snying rje chen po la bslab par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpas ni ji nas kyang mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams dga' bar 'gyur ba de ltar bsgrub par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpas ni rang gi sems kho na shin tu bsrung bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la bslab par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpas ni ji nas kyang mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams dga' bar 'gyur ba de ltar bsgrub par bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpas ni rang gi sems kho na shin tu bsrung bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva should guard his own mind.üîΩAnd:

analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du ji ltar bslab pa ste spyod yul yongs su dag pa las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
translated: In all situations of daily activity, one should train in whatever way has been taught, as it has been taught in the Perfectly Pure Sphere of Activity.

original: 'o na de'i tshe rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga las gang dang gang la ji ltar bslab @318b ce na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i tshe rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga las gang dang gang la ji ltar bslab @318b ce na /
translated: Well then, at that time, what and how does one train in the five branches of knowledge?

original: rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga po mtha' dag la dam pa drug gis zin pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga po mtha' dag la dam pa drug gis zin pa'i tshul gyis bslab par bya ba yin pas /
translated: One should train in all five branches of knowledge by way of being endowed with the six supremacies.

original: rgyal sras rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyal sras rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: 'di skad du mdo sde rgyan las /
analyzed: 'di skad du mdo sde rgyan las /

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag las byang bar ma byas na //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag las byang bar ma byas na //

analyzed: 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid thob mi 'gyur //
translated: Even the most exalted of beings will not attain omniscience.üîΩTherefore, in order to refute others and to care for them,

analyzed: de bas gzhan dag tshar gcad rjes su gzung phyir dang // bdag nyid dul bar bya phyir de la de brtson byed // ces gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And to tame oneself, one should strive in these.

original: 'on te de la phan yon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te de la phan yon ci yod ce na /
translated: Well then, what benefit is there in that?

original: de ltar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThose who abide in this way‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de ltar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni dam pa drug gis zin pa'i phyir de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni dam pa drug gis zin pa'i phyir de ji lta zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who abide in this way‚Äù means that because they are endowed with the six supremacies, they are like that. How is that?

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du byang chub chen po thob par bya ba'i bsam pas rig pa'i gnas lnga po de dag la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri mas ma gos par slob cing dge ba'i rtsa ba
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du byang chub chen po thob par bya ba'i bsam pas rig pa'i gnas lnga po de dag la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i tshul gyis so so'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri mas ma gos par slob cing dge ba'i rtsa ba
translated: One should train in those five sciences with the intention of attaining great enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings, without being stained by the defilements that are adverse to each of them, by means of the method of the complete purity of the three sectors.

original: de yang byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yang byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir te /

original: de ltar go rims bzhin du ched du bya ba dang / rten dang dngos po dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dam pas yongs su rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni mdor na sems can gyi don yin pas dngos sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ci byas pa thams cad yongs su bsngo ba dam pas zin par bya ba'i phyir sems can kho na'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ci byas pa thams cad yongs su bsngo ba dam pas zin par bya ba'i phyir sems can kho na'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
