analyzed: da ni 'jug pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyang las la rag las pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa'i dus su phan tshun dge ba'i sems su 'gyur gyi / de las gzhan pa'i sems su mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that since everything depends on karma, in the future time, all will become virtuous minds through mutual dependence,

original: da ltar gyi dus su bsod nams la 'bad par bya'o zhes bstan @324b par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su bsod nams la 'bad par bya'o zhes bstan @324b par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and that one should strive in merit in the present time in order to make them become other than that,

original: de ltar mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúHaving seen thus . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa brgyad stong pa las gang g'a'i lha mo'i le'u'i nang nas ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa brgyad stong pa las gang g'a'i lha mo'i le'u'i nang nas ji skad gsungs pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should practice just as it is taught in the chapter of the goddess of the Ganges in the noble Eight Thousand.

original: da ni zhe sdang gi rgyu spangs pa'i sgo nas zhe sdang spang bar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni zhe sdang gi rgyu spangs pa'i sgo nas zhe sdang spang bar bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the abandonment of hatred by means of abandoning the causes of hatred, he says:

original: dper na khyim tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na khyim tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, when a house is burning,

original: gang la lhag par chags pa de la bdag gis gnod par byas pas zhe sdang 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la lhag par chags pa de la bdag gis gnod par byas pas zhe sdang 'byung ba'i phyir /

original: chags pa ni zhe sdang gi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: chags pa ni zhe sdang gi rgyu yin la /

original: bskal pa stong du bsags pa'i zhe sdang bya ba la sogs pa gong du bstan pa bzhin du zhe sdang skyes pa'i dbang gis bsod nams tshig par dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bskal pa stong du bsags pa'i zhe sdang bya ba la sogs pa gong du bstan pa bzhin du zhe sdang skyes pa'i dbang gis bsod nams tshig par dogs pa'i phyir /

analyzed: zhe sdang spong ba'i don du de'i rgyu lhag par chags pa spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that in order to abandon hatred, one should abandon attachment, which is its cause.

original: 'on te de spong ba'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal bzod par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de spong ba'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal bzod par mi nus so zhe na /

original: sdug bsngal chen po spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal chen po spang ba'i phyir /

original: de spong ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i sdug bsngal bzod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: de spong ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i sdug bsngal bzod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: you should bear the suffering that is the means of abandoning it.

original: ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ngan song gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon the cause of the suffering of the three miserable realms,

original: zhe sdang gi rgyu 'dod chags spong ba'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal la bzod par bya ba'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi rgyu 'dod chags spong ba'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal la bzod par bya ba'i sgo nas /
translated: you should bear the suffering that occurs when you abandon desire, which is the cause of hatred.

original: zhe sdang bzlog par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhe sdang bzlog par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that you should abandon hatred.

original: yang gang gi tshe res 'ga' bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs par sgrub pa'i don byed par yang 'bral gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan tsam bsgrub pa'i don du mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa yang bzod par nus na /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe res 'ga' bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs par sgrub pa'i don byed par yang 'bral gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan tsam bsgrub pa'i don du mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa yang bzod par nus na /
translated: Moreover, when you sometimes do things that are beneficial for the sake of achieving high status and definite goodness for yourself and others, you may have to endure immeasurable suffering in the hells and so forth, due to the cause of nonvirtuous karma.

original: lhag par chags pa spang ba'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal 'di ni ci ste bzod par mi nus te /
analyzed: lhag par chags pa spang ba'i gnas skabs kyi sdug bsngal 'di ni ci ste bzod par mi nus te /
translated: Why is it that one cannot bear the suffering that occurs when one abandons excessive attachment?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal de tsam du gnod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal de tsam du gnod pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the suffering of the hells and so on is not so harmful.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de la brten nas zhe sdang la sogs pa spang ba'i rim gyis glags dang / gzhan gyi don chen po mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa yang 'grub pa'i phyir /üîΩ'gro ba bdag dang gzhan gyi don chen po mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i zhe sdang gi rgyu lhag par chags pa spang ba'i gnas skabs su sdug bsngal dang du blang ba 'di la phan yon mthong ba'i sgo nas @325a * //
analyzed: de la brten nas zhe sdang la sogs pa spang ba'i rim gyis glags dang / gzhan gyi don chen po mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa yang 'grub pa'i phyir / 'gro ba bdag dang gzhan gyi don chen po mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i zhe sdang gi rgyu lhag par chags pa spang ba'i gnas skabs su sdug bsngal dang du blang ba 'di la phan yon mthong ba'i sgo nas @325a * //
translated: Because, in dependence on that, one gradually abandons anger and so on, and one accomplishes the great benefit of self and other, which is high status and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: dga' ba bskyed par rigs kyi /
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed par rigs kyi /
translated: It is right to generate joy by seeing the benefit in this suffering that occurs when one abandons the cause of anger, excessive attachment, which is the cause of the great benefit of self and other, high status and the definite goodness of liberation.üîΩOne should not be discouraged.

original: sgyid lug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgyid lug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: da ni zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa phrag dog spong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni zhe sdang gi char gtogs pa phrag dog spong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in terms of abandoning envy, which is a part of anger,

original: gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pa thos pa'i tshe de la phrag dog spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pa thos pa'i tshe de la phrag dog spang ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to abandon envy when one hears praise of others‚Äô good qualities,

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf others praise someone else‚Äôs good qualities,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig gis gzhan gyi yon tan dang ldan pa la bstod pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig gis gzhan gyi yon tan dang ldan pa la bstod pa'i rgyus /
translated: If someone praises another person who has good qualities,

original: bstod pa'i yul de'i yid la dga' ba skye na /üîΩde'i tshe yid khyod kyis kyang pha rol po de la bstod pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyis bstod cing dga' bar byas pa ltar /
analyzed: bstod pa'i yul de'i yid la dga' ba skye na / de'i tshe yid khyod kyis kyang pha rol po de la bstod pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyis bstod cing dga' bar byas pa ltar /
translated: and if the object of praise feels joy in his mind,

original: ci'i phyir dga' bar mi byed de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dga' bar mi byed de /
translated: then, Mind, why do you not rejoice in that person who is praised by others and made happy by the praise?

analyzed: dga' bar bya bar rigs so zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'on te de ltar na byas na phan yon ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na byas na phan yon ci yod snyam na /
translated: But if one thinks, ‚ÄúIf I do it that way, what benefit is there?‚Äù

original: khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIf you do not rejoice,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gzhan yon tan dang ldan pa khyod kyi yid dga' ba dang bde ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang bdag nyid la gzhan gyis bstod pa la sogs pa'i rgyus yid dga' ba'i bde ba 'byung la /
analyzed: gzhan yon tan dang ldan pa khyod kyi yid dga' ba dang bde ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang bdag nyid la gzhan gyis bstod pa la sogs pa'i rgyus yid dga' ba'i bde ba 'byung la /
translated: Moreover, in the future, you will be pleased and happy when others praise you and so on.

original: gzhan yang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims bcu gcig las gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pas dga' bar byed pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims bcu gcig las gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pas dga' bar byed pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, it is ethical discipline that delights others by expressing their good qualities, from among the eleven types of ethical discipline that benefit sentient beings.üîΩIt is also irreproachable.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa yang yin zhing de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas kyang /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa yang yin zhing de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pas kyang /
translated: For that reason, the Tathagata also

analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa las /
translated: in the noble perfection of wisdom and so onüîΩhas permitted the part of action that is to be done for those who possess good qualities, stating:

analyzed: gzhan gang dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas pa de dag gi legs pa brjod cing mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la bya ba'i cha yin par gnang ba yin no //

original: der ma zad kyi gzhan la yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du brjod cing dga' bar byed pa 'di ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las snyan par smra ba zhes bya ste /üîΩbdag nyid la tshogs chung ba'i sgo nas gzhan mos par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der ma zad kyi gzhan la yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du brjod cing dga' bar byed pa 'di ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi las snyan par smra ba zhes bya ste / bdag nyid la tshogs chung ba'i sgo nas gzhan mos par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, this is pleasant speech among the four ways of gathering disciples.

original: gzhan bsdu ba'i mchog kyang yin zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan bsdu ba'i mchog kyang yin zhes bshad do //
translated: It is the best way of gathering others because it causes others to be interested in oneself through the door of little effort.

original: gal te 'di snyam du pha rol po bstod pa'i yul de la gzhan gyis bstod pas dga' bar byed pa de ltar bdag gis ni bstod kyang dga' ba mi skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du pha rol po bstod pa'i yul de la gzhan gyis bstod pas dga' bar byed pa de ltar bdag gis ni bstod kyang dga' ba mi skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúI do not praise others because they are pleased when others praise the object of praise, but I do not feel pleased when I praise,‚Äù

original: stod par mi byed do //
analyzed: stod par mi byed do //
translated: you should not praise.

original: snyan pa'i dogs pa bsus nas /
analyzed: snyan pa'i dogs pa bsus nas /
translated: To anticipate the objection, he says,

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, if you do not praise others,

original: gzhan ni bdag gis bstod du zin kyang pha rol gyis bstod pas yul de'i rgyud la dga' ba skye ba de ltar bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro @325b zhes gal te yid khyod bstod pa'i yul de'i rgyud la yid dga' ba'i bde ba 'di skye bar mi
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag gis bstod du zin kyang pha rol gyis bstod pas yul de'i rgyud la dga' ba skye ba de ltar bde ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro @325b zhes gal te yid khyod bstod pa'i yul de'i rgyud la yid dga' ba'i bde ba 'di skye bar mi
translated: Even if others praise you, you will not feel happy about it.

original: 'dod na de'i tshe srog gcod pa spong ba dang / gla pa la gla rngan sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod na de'i tshe srog gcod pa spong ba dang / gla pa la gla rngan sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: If you do not want to feel happy about the object of praise, then what is the point of abandoning killing, giving wages to workers and so on?

original: mthong ba ste 'dir gla pas las byed pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba ste /üîΩtshe phyi mar mtho ris thob pa la sogs pa yang nyams te mi 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de'i tshe srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba ste 'dir gla pas las byed pa la sogs pa ma mthong ba ste / tshe phyi mar mtho ris thob pa la sogs pa yang nyams te mi 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de'i tshe srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: You will not see the results of abandoning killing and so on,üîΩsuch as attaining high rebirth in the next life and so on.

original: 'bras bu mtho ris su skye ba la sogs pa gdon mi za bar 'byung du rung ba bzhin du /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtho ris su skye ba la sogs pa gdon mi za bar 'byung du rung ba bzhin du /

original: gzhan la bstod pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu de bdag gis byas na yang de'i tshe de'i 'bras bu pha rol po de'i rgyud la yid dga' ba skye bar 'gyur bas /

translated: And if I am the cause of someone else being praised, then at that time, the result of that action will be the arising of mental pleasure in the mind of that other person.

original: pha rol po de la gzhan gyis bstod pa'i tshe bdag gis kyang bstod par bya'i /
analyzed: pha rol po de la gzhan gyis bstod pa'i tshe bdag gis kyang bstod par bya'i /

original: phrag dog mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phrag dog mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: yang ji ltar gzhan gyis bdag rang gi yon tan brjod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yang ji ltar gzhan gyis bdag rang gi yon tan brjod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when others speak of my good qualities,

analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gis gzhan gyi yon tan brjod pa'i dus de'i tshe /

analyzed: pha rol po de bdag rang la yid dga' zhing bde ba skye bar ji ste mi 'dod par byed de /

original: gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'dod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: I certainly should want that, the text says.

original: da ni pha rol po yon tan dang ldan pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po yon tan dang ldan pa la sogs pa mthong ba'i tshe /
translated: Now, when you see someone who has good qualities and so on,

analyzed: de la phrag dog spong bar bstan pa'i sems can thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, the verse ‚ÄúI generated the mind of enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings‚Äù and so forth is stated.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du dang por byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad kyi don du dang por byang chub tu sems bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because I generated the mind of enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings,

original: gang gi tshe bdag gis ma bsgrubs par sems can nyid kyis bde ba phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag gis ma bsgrubs par sems can nyid kyis bde ba phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa de'i tshe /

analyzed: de la shin tu dga' bar bya bar rigs kyi phrag dog mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: at that time it is proper to be very pleased with them, and I should not be jealous.

original: da ni zhe sdang la brten pa'i chos rnam pa gnyis las /
analyzed: da ni zhe sdang la brten pa'i chos rnam pa gnyis las /
translated: Now, of the two types of phenomena based on hatred,

analyzed: dang po dgra la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal byung ba'i tshe /
translated: first, when suffering occurs to an enemy and so forth,

original: de la rjes su yi rang ba spang bar bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de la rjes su yi rang ba spang bar bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: the verse ‚ÄúIf an enemy or someone who is neutral‚Äù and so forth is stated in order to demonstrate the abandonment of rejoicing in that.

original: gal te dgra zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te dgra zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf an enemy‚Äù and so forth.

original: byung ba nyid kyis chog mod de la dga' ba bskyed mod med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung ba nyid kyis chog mod de la dga' ba bskyed mod med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is enough that it has occurred‚Äù means ‚ÄúI do not need to generate joy in that.‚Äù

original: da ni nyes pa ma byung ba las yid smon mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni nyes pa ma byung ba las yid smon mi bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one should not long for what has not been done, he says:üîΩIf you long for what has been done by another,

analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te yid smon @326a * // byas pa'i gzhis sdug bsngal de /

original: pha rol po la grub pa'i phyir de la gdags par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol po la grub pa'i phyir de la gdags par byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that you impute that suffering to the other person because of the basis of your longing,

analyzed: khyod kyi 'dod pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBut that is not right, because of your desire.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de yang grub pa nyid kyis chog mod /
analyzed: de yang grub pa nyid kyis chog mod /
translated: Moreover, it is enough that it is established;

original: de la dga' bar bya mi dgos zhes bya ba'i don te //üîΩgal te des mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phyir de la bdag dga' bar byed do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dga' bar bya mi dgos zhes bya ba'i don te // gal te des mtshungs par 'gyur ba'i phyir de la bdag dga' bar byed do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: it is not necessary to delight in it.

original: de las phung ba gzhan ci yod //üîΩces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de las phung ba gzhan ci yod // ces bya ba smos so //
translated: If you say that you delight in it because it is the same for you, he says, ‚ÄúWhat greater misfortune could there be?‚Äù

original: ji ltar phung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar phung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is there misfortune?

original: nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: nyon mongs pa'i nya bas btab pa'i mchil pa ste lcags kyu'o //
